info.description: API to allow the creation, viewing and management of beneficiaries
info.title: Management of Beneficiaries

parameters.name: beneficiaryId
parameters.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieves the list of beneficiary details for a customers

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: nickName
parameters.description: Nickname of the beneficiary

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the list of beneficiaries details for specific customer

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: externalBeneficiaryFlag
parameters.description: Flag to identify if the beneficiary is external

parameters.name: paymentScheme
parameters.description: Payment scheme details

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

beneficiaryBICIBANNames.description: Contains the name of the beneficiary's BIC IBAN number

beneficiaryBICIBANName.description: Contains the name of the beneficiary's BIC IBAN number

paymentDetails.description: Indicates the payment details for the beneficiary to apply the payment.

paymentDetail.description: Indicates the payment details for the beneficiary to apply the payment.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

transactionType.description: Identifies the transaction type applicable to the transaction being processed, i.e. outward or inward payment. For example: ACPX, OTPX etc.

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

bankSortCode.description: The sort code or the national clearing code of the beneficiary bank.

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

beneficiaryBIC.description: BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the beneficiary customer

defaultNarrative.description: The default narrative which will be provided on the debit and credit side of the payment.

linkToBeneficiaryId.description: For a customer defined beneficiaries, it specifies the link to bank defined beneficiaries.

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

preferredPaymentAmount.description: Preferred payment amount can be specified for the beneficiary. If specified, it will be populated during payment processing.

preferredPaymentProduct.description: Preferred payment product can be specified for Beneficiary. This will be used for defaulting the payment product for specific beneficiary.

accountWithBank.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

paymentCountry.description: The country to which a payment is sent, usually where the beneficiary resides

accountWithBankSortCode.description: Bank sort code details with account

shortName.description: Contains the name of the account, basically the short title of the account.

bankName.description: The name of the bank being referred to.

beneficiaryAddressCity.description: City of the beneficiary account. For example: London, Dallas etc.

postCode.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

subDepartmentId.description: Contains a sub-division identifier of a large organisation or building

buildingNumber.description: Identifies the building number where customer resides

buildingName.description: Identifies the name of the building where customer resides

floorNumber.description: Contains the floor number of the customer address

postBoxNumber.description: Post Office Box (POB) number that relates to financial institution

apartmentNumber.description: Identifies the apartment number of the customer address

town.description: The town associated with the address of Customer or Party

districtName.description: Stores the district name of the  Beneficiary Customer.

state.description: Represents a subdivision of a country such as state, region, country

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

code.description: The identifier of the error message

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

dates.description: Date in the format YYYYMMDD. E.g. 20191231

dateTime.description: Contains the date and time separated by '-'

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

categoryId.description: Unique identifier associated with the product name of the account or contract. For example: For customer/counterparty accounts, the identifier would be in the range 1000 to 9999. For ledger accounts, in the range 10000 to 19999.

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

transactionType.description: Identifies the transaction type applicable to the transaction being processed, i.e. outward or inward payment. For example: ACPX, OTPX etc.

bankSortCode.description: The sort code or the national clearing code of the beneficiary bank.

BIC.description: The BIC code of the Beneficiary bank

IBAN.description: International Bank Account number, an identifier of the account. E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

linkBeneficiaryId.description: The identifier of a beneficiary (defined by the institution) being linked to a customer-defined beneficiary

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

accountWithBank.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

preferredPaymentAmount.description: Preferred payment amount can be specified for the beneficiary. If specified, it will be populated during payment processing.

ourCharges.description: The charge borne by the bank for providing a financial service. Possible values: -BEN -OUR -SHA

paymentCountry.description: The country to which a payment is sent, usually where the beneficiary resides

preferredPaymentProduct.description: Preferred payment product can be specified for Beneficiary. This will be used for defaulting the payment product for specific beneficiary.

defaultNarrative.description: The default narrative which will be provided on the debit and credit side of the payment.

bankName.description: The name of the bank being referred to.

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddressCity.description: City of the beneficiary account. For example: London, Dallas etc.

postCode.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer.

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

beneficiaryCustomerNickName.description: Contains the nickname of the beneficiary Customer

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

companyName.description: The company in which payment is processed

categoryId.description: Unique identifier associated with the product name of the account or contract. For example: For customer/counterparty accounts, the identifier would be in the range 1000 to 9999. For ledger accounts, in the range 10000 to 19999.

transactionType.description: Identifies the transaction type applicable to the transaction being processed, i.e. outward or inward payment. For example: ACPX, OTPX etc.

bankSortCode.description: The sort code or the national clearing code of the beneficiary bank.

linkToBeneficiaryId.description: For a customer defined beneficiaries, it specifies the link to bank defined beneficiaries.

preferredPaymentAmount.description: Preferred payment amount can be specified for the beneficiary. If specified, it will be populated during payment processing.

paymentCountry.description: The country to which a payment is sent, usually where the beneficiary resides

preferredPaymentProductId.description: Denotes the identifier of the preferred payment product
